column5: On Sunday I decided to give Scugog one last try for the year, I fished on the Port Perry side in 5-6 feet of water. The water temp was pretty cold 39 degrees and there was ice forming in patches on the lake, these gulls were taking a rest on some.  this was the main bait I was going to use today (cast out and slow retrieve). I fished the Port Perry side for 2 hrs, then decided to fish just south of Cesarea, fished that area  for a couple of hrs and headed back to the west side for another hour and called it a day. No fish were landed but it was a learning experience (a cold one).
Sorry to hear that Mike.  Think the love-hate scugog relationship has swung to the right side the last couple trips  Ahh well, always next year.
Try orange and black next time and hang on...
Try to troll in scugog river. Some muskie are cruising there.
